p: A mid-to-high emissions scenario (SRES A2) was selected because the recent global CO 2 emissions trajectory has fallen at the high end of the range of projections used in IPCC scenarios [ 26]. Use of previously-published niche models limited the analysis to CMIP3 data rather than the recently-released CMIP5 projections. However, because CMIP5 projections are an incremental advance over CMIP3 data [ 27, 28], this decision does not substantially limit the relevance of our results as a tool for threat assessment. Temperature projections from the SRES A2 scenario are intermediate to those of CMIP5 representative concentration pathways (RCP) 6.0 and 8.5 [ 28, 29].
